pr_title: Upgrade JAX-RS / MP Rest Client CXF bundles to 3.4.1 Snapshot

timeline.bodyText: is this going to affect any customers who might be setting this property? Or do we not expose this property and we're fine to just use CXF's property?
timeline.author: WhiteCat22

replies.bodyText:
is this going to affect any customers who might be setting this property? Or do we not expose this property and we're fine to just use CXF's property?

The latter.  We don't expose this property - it is only used internally for cases where the user has invoked an SSL-related API in either the JAX-RS Client or MP Rest Client - then we set that property so that we override the normal SSL config process with the setting specified by the user.
replies.author: andymc12

timeline.author: WhiteCat22

timeline.bodyText: we should always specify EXACT on the versions to avoid potential "soft matching" artifacts in Artifactory. I've had to sort out those issues before where a new artifact gets uploaded and for some reason it starts matching to the wrong version.

timeline.diffHunk:

--include= jar:${fileuri;${repo;org.apache.cxf:cxf-core;3.2.6}}!/META-INF/MANIFEST.MF,bnd.overrides
+-include= jar:${fileuri;${repo;org.apache.cxf:cxf-core;3.4.0}}!/META-INF/MANIFEST.MF,bnd.overrides

timeline.bodyText: leads me to believe we don't need EXACT on the others for now? not sure. Enjoy the spam.
timeline.author: WhiteCat22
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,49 @@
+#*******************************************************************************
+# Copyright (c) 2020 IBM Corporation and others.
+# All rights reserved. This program and the accompanying materials
+# are made available under the terms of the Eclipse Public License v1.0
+# which accompanies this distribution, and is available at
+# http://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-v10.html
+#
+# Contributors:
+# IBM Corporation - initial API and implementation
+#*******************************************************************************
+-include= ~../cnf/resources/bnd/bundle.props
+bVersion=1.0
+
+
+Bundle-SymbolicName: io.openliberty.org.eclipse.microprofile.rest.client.2.0; singleton:=true
+
+Export-Package: \
+  org.eclipse.microprofile.rest.client;version=1.4,\
+  org.eclipse.microprofile.rest.client.annotation;version=1.1,\
+  org.eclipse.microprofile.rest.client.ext;version=1.2,\
+  org.eclipse.microprofile.rest.client.inject;version=1.2.1,\
+  org.eclipse.microprofile.rest.client.spi;version=1.1.1
+
+Import-Package: \
+	javax.annotation;version='[1.3,2)',\
+	javax.enterprise.context;version='[2.0,2.1)',\
+	javax.enterprise.inject;version='[2.0,2.1)',\
+	javax.enterprise.util;version='[2.0,2.1)',\
+	javax.inject;version='[2.0,2.1)',\
+	javax.ws.rs.core;version='[2.1,3)',\
+	org.eclipse.microprofile.rest.client;version='[2.0,2.1)',\
+	org.eclipse.microprofile.rest.client.spi;version='[2.0,2.1)',\
+	*
+
+Include-Resource: \
+  @${repo;org.eclipse.microprofile.rest.client:microprofile-rest-client-api;2.0}
+# TODO: when replacing 2.0-RC2 with 2.0, make sure to add EXACT:

timeline.message: Review comments and tweak to fix client failures

timeline.bodyText: I would recommend including "ibm" or similar in the snapshot version to make it clear we built it e.g. org.apache.cxf:cxf-rt-transports-http:3.4.1-ibm20201002. The wiki for this goes a step further and suggests changing the group id to com.ibm.ws.org.apache.cxf ... I think that is overkill.
timeline.author: tevans78

replies.bodyText:
All of these binaries are actual CXF snapshots available (for a limited time) at:
https://repository.apache.org/content/groups/snapshots/org/apache/cxf/
We're still using the overlay approach (for now) so all IBM changes are part of the Open Liberty repo.  But this PR ends up removing ~30 overlayed files which should make it easier to move off of that approach.
replies.author: andymc12

timeline.message: Use EXACT coordinates for MP Rest Client APIs
Review comments and tweak to fix client failures
